extendedInfo.description: Cisco Data Meter allows you to easily monitor your mobile data usage, test cell and wi-fi connection speeds, and find nearby wi-fi hotspots. - Find out which apps are using the most data- Track current data usage and estimate usage over time - Easy-to-understand views of daily and monthly data activities - Integrated cell and wi-fi speed tests and wi-fi hotspot locator- Supports Android smartphones and tablets***** âVery nice interface, easy to use and track data usage.â***** âUseful and looks great.â***** âGreat app! I highly recommend it.âFeatures:- Data usage monitoring for Android smartphones and tablets, from version 2.2 to 4.1 (Jelly Bean) and Nexus 7 - Test download, upload, and ping speeds for both wi-fi and cell connections- Find nearby Google Places hotspots where other users have tested wi-fi speeds- Visit the Cisco Data Meter website to view aggregated global and regional mobile data usage metrics   (http://www.ciscovni.com/data-meter) - Compare your data usage to other Data Meter users from around the world- No continuous foreground service;  the service only runs briefly on a connection state change so Data Meter consumes less battery lifeKeywords: data counter, data monitor, data tracker, data manager, data traffic, smartphone usage, tablet usage, mobile Internet, network traffic

reviews.title: One major flaw
reviews.comment: It doesn\'t work. Surfed the web with Chrome, downloaded some apps from the Play Store and streamed some music. Data usage still displays 0 used. Tested on Verizon S4 with LTE.
reviews.author: Cory Streater

reviews.title: CISCO DATA METER
reviews.comment: The. Spped classifcation is not at all visible,  on tab2 Samsung.  Please fix this either by sliding screen up.  Add option for white theme with blue inlay. That would be more pleasent.. the app is great, simple and informative. Make it a beautiful layout. That would be mare attractive .I will give7 stars if fixed and will share with my family and friends. Respond early.   George
reviews.author: George Fernandes

reviews.title: Can\'t do half gig allowance
reviews.comment: Totally useless, I have a 1.5 gb allowance each month, but it will only let me put in either 1 or   2 gb. So unusable for me
reviews.author: Richard Gammans

reviews.title: Useless
reviews.comment: This app is 100% useless for me. For 1. It does not do half GBs. And 2. it is not tracking one single byte of data for WiFi on my phone. I have downloaded over 40MB of data and yet the app shows it at a zero still, and it does not even show any apps that used data. I love Cisco, but this app is a failure.
reviews.author: Dominic Di Costanzo

reviews.title: Poor
reviews.comment: Very limited options for setting data usage limits. Cannot alert when near or over limit. Reports Android system app usage by splitting the total for the UID among all the apps that share the UID, which is erroneous.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cell data is not accurate
reviews.comment: Cell data is not accurate on Samsung galaxy s2. However, great interface.
reviews.author: David Beards

reviews.title: Cant edit used data
reviews.comment: I installed this app at middle of my billing cycle.. but it doesnt allow me to add the used data till the date... expected better app from Cisco... un installing.. data manager is better
reviews.author: Reni Rocks

reviews.title: Is this app from Cisco?
reviews.comment: I wander Howe can Cisco create such low level apps? I am Cisco certified engineer, and this app is just a disappointment for me.
reviews.author: Sergio Torosyan

reviews.title: Trust
reviews.comment: Other apps like this one cannot be trusted. Most of the other n/w usage apps will have rootkits running and they will be monitoring our n/w usage. Being a cisco app i have full trust on this app. Great one...keep on improving.
reviews.author: arun m

reviews.title: In accurate....
reviews.comment: Not all the apps that I use are monitored.
reviews.author: Ryan Lehnert

reviews.title: can\'t delete mistake?
reviews.comment: I didn\'t understand what I was doing and I accidentally added WiFi test to a place I didn\'t test the WiFi and  now I can\'t figure out how to delete it, is it not possible? I\'ll give 5 stars if it is possible to delete that fake WiFi spot.
reviews.author: Jay H

reviews.title: Cell Phones
reviews.comment: I tried this on my Nexus 7 3G tablet, but it seems to be more for cell phones.
reviews.author: Victory Gasper

reviews.title: Seems cool
reviews.comment: I hope it monitoring apps won\'t kill my battery though
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: fc
reviews.comment: force closed if you move the left slider of data usage graphic (lg optimus s) uninstalled
reviews.author: Aditya Pradipta

reviews.title: no unicode for public spot list
reviews.comment: place name and description is ok on the map but not in the list. cannot display foreign characters in spot list. cannot set 1.5gb as limit -- only 1 or 2.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: I sometimes use Internet on my nexus7 using Bluetooth tethering,it is unable to detect it.Otherwise it is good app.
reviews.author: Zia Ullah

reviews.title: GREAT APP
reviews.comment: Easy to use & simple design app for Android users like me, thanx
reviews.author: Windi Primiadhi

reviews.title: DROIDX2
reviews.comment: Reports about double the cell data usage compared to Verizon.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: I highly recommend it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment: Not a bad app. Does what it should. Like the UI
reviews.author: A Google User
